summary: This is a public letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Judge Paul A. Engelmayer regarding a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times Company against the Federal Bureau of Prisons. The letter seeks leave to file a separate sealed, ex parte letter containing sensitive information related to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating the government is withholding certain confidential records.

persons.name: Paul A. Engelmayer
persons.context: Presiding judge over the FOIA case The New York Times Co. v. Federal Bureau of Prisons. The letter is addressed to him requesting permission to file a sealed submission.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is respectfully submitting the letter to the court on behalf of the government.

persons.name: Steven J. Kochevar
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney who authored and signed the letter on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office, representing the Federal Bureau of Prisons in the FOIA case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and convicted sex offender whose records are being sought by The New York Times Company under the Freedom of Information Act.

connections.description: Strauss is the United States Attorney and Kochevar is an Assistant United States Attorney in the same office, with Kochevar acting under her authority.
Kochevar, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is representing the Federal Bureau of Prisons (the defendant) in the FOIA lawsuit.
Judge Engelmayer is the presiding judicial officer in the case, and Kochevar is an attorney formally communicating with the court on behalf of a party.

events.title: Filing of Sealed Letter Request
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a public letter with the court seeking permission to file a separate sealed, ex parte letter containing sensitive information about Jeffrey Epstein records held by the Bureau of Prisons.

locations: 86 Chambers Street, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The New York Times Company is suing the Federal Bureau of Prisons under FOIA to obtain records related to Jeffrey Epstein.

The U.S. Attorney's Office is seeking to file a sealed, ex parte letter to the judge, arguing it contains sensitive and confidential information that cannot be publicly described without compromising confidentiality.
The government has conferred with The New York Times about the filing of the sealed letter.
The document indicates ongoing legal efforts to control the release of information about Jeffrey Epstein held by the Bureau of Prisons.
